com.radiotelescope.security

Class FakeUserContext

  • com.radiotelescope.security.FakeUserContext
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UserContext

    public class FakeUserContext
implements UserContext

    Fake implementation of the interface UserContext object for use in in-memory tests

    See Also:
    interface UserContext

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FakeUserContext()
      Fake implementation of the interface UserContext object for use in in-memory tests

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Long currentUserId()
      Test implementation of the UserContext.currentUserId method that will return the FakeUserContext.currentUserId if it is greater than 0 (meaning they are logged in), and -1 otherwise (signifying they are not logged in
      java.util.List<com.radiotelescope.repository.role.UserRole.Role> getCurrentRoles() 
      void login(long userId)
      Used in test cases to simulate a login (where the role of Guest is added) and the FakeUserContext.currentUserId is updated to the parameter
      void logout()
      Used in test cases to simulate a logout (where the list of roles are cleared) and the FakeUserContext.currentUserId is updated back to -1
      <S,E> SecuredAction<S,E> require(java.util.List<? extends com.radiotelescope.repository.role.UserRole.Role> requiredRoles, Command<? extends S,? extends E> successCommand)
      Test implementation of the UserContext.require method. It will check the current roles against the required roles and if any are missing, this means validation has failed. In the event validation fails, we will return an class AccessReport data class containing a list of the missing roles. If validation succeeds, we will call the success command inside of the withAccess anonymous function parameter, which returns a class SimpleResult data class containing the success data type OR the failure data type
      <S,E> SecuredAction<S,E> requireAny(java.util.List<? extends com.radiotelescope.repository.role.UserRole.Role> requiredRoles, Command<? extends S,? extends E> successCommand)
      Test implementation of the UserContext.requireAny method. It will check the current roles against the required roles and if any of the required roles are found in the current roles list, then the user's action is allowed. Otherwise we will return an class AccessReport data class with a list of the missing roles
      void setCurrentRoles(java.util.List<com.radiotelescope.repository.role.UserRole.Role> p) 

      • Methods inherited from interface com.radiotelescope.security.UserContext

        currentUserId, require, requireAny

        Fake implementation of the interface UserContext object for use in in-memory tests

        See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • getCurrentRoles

        public java.util.List<com.radiotelescope.repository.role.UserRole.Role> getCurrentRoles()

      • setCurrentRoles

        public void setCurrentRoles(java.util.List<com.radiotelescope.repository.role.UserRole.Role> p)

      • require

        public <S,E> SecuredAction<S,E> require(java.util.List<? extends com.radiotelescope.repository.role.UserRole.Role> requiredRoles,
                                        Command<? extends S,? extends E> successCommand)

        Test implementation of the UserContext.require method. It will check the current roles against the required roles and if any are missing, this means validation has failed. In the event validation fails, we will return an class AccessReport data class containing a list of the missing roles. If validation succeeds, we will call the success command inside of the withAccess anonymous function parameter, which returns a class SimpleResult data class containing the success data type OR the failure data type

        NOTE: Kotlin can tell if the withAccess anonymous function was called or not, and the class SimpleResult method it uses can be used in by the method that called this

        See Also:
        UserContext.require, class AccessReport, class SimpleResult, class SimpleResult

      • requireAny

        public <S,E> SecuredAction<S,E> requireAny(java.util.List<? extends com.radiotelescope.repository.role.UserRole.Role> requiredRoles,
                                           Command<? extends S,? extends E> successCommand)

        Test implementation of the UserContext.requireAny method. It will check the current roles against the required roles and if any of the required roles are found in the current roles list, then the user's action is allowed. Otherwise we will return an class AccessReport data class with a list of the missing roles

        See Also:
        UserContext.requireAny, class AccessReport

      • currentUserId

        public java.lang.Long currentUserId()

        Test implementation of the UserContext.currentUserId method that will return the FakeUserContext.currentUserId if it is greater than 0 (meaning they are logged in), and -1 otherwise (signifying they are not logged in

        See Also:
        UserContext.currentUserId, FakeUserContext.currentUserId

      • login

        public void login(long userId)

        Used in test cases to simulate a login (where the role of Guest is added) and the FakeUserContext.currentUserId is updated to the parameter

        See Also:
        FakeUserContext.currentUserId

      • logout

        public void logout()

        Used in test cases to simulate a logout (where the list of roles are cleared) and the FakeUserContext.currentUserId is updated back to -1

        See Also:
        FakeUserContext.currentUserId
